title: Rapier
data:
A **rapier** is a type of sword that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [dNethack](/wiki/DNethack "DNethack"). It is made of [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal") and uses the [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") skill.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 dNethack](#dNethack)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Reference](#Reference)

## SLASH'EM

| ) [![Rapier.png](/images/7/7b/Rapier.png)](/wiki/File:Rapier.png) |                                                         |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | rapier                                                  |
| Appearance                                                        | rapier                                                  |
| Damage vs. small                                                  | 1d6                                                     |
| Damage vs. large                                                  | 1d8                                                     |
| To-hit bonus                                                      | +0                                                      |
| Weapon skill                                                      | [saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber")              |
| Size                                                              | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")             |
| Base price                                                        | 40 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                            | [30](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material                                                          | [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal")                            |

Rapiers are comparable in damage to sabers while being somewhat lighter.

### Generation

Rapiers are not randomly generated in SLASH'EM. A [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [rogue](/wiki/Rogue_\(player_monster\) "Rogue (player monster)") in the halls of [Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold") will [always generate with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [+1](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") rapier.

Comments in the source code indicate that a rapier was intended to be the [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") for an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") named [Scalpel](/wiki/Scalpel_\(artifact\) "Scalpel (artifact)"), which was carried over from [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## dNethack

| ) [![Rapier.png](/images/7/7b/Rapier.png)](/wiki/File:Rapier.png) |                                                         |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | rapier                                                  |
| Appearance                                                        | rapier                                                  |
| Damage vs. small                                                  | 1d6                                                     |
| Damage vs. large                                                  | 1d4                                                     |
| To-hit bonus                                                      | +0                                                      |
| Weapon skill                                                      | [saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber")              |
| Size                                                              | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")             |
| Base price                                                        | 20 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                            | [28](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material                                                          | [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal")                            |

In dNetHack, rapiers are medium-sized, one-handed piercing weapons. They receive only half the normal strength bonus to damage, but also gain a (DEX - 11)⁄2 bonus.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Rapier](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapier "wikipedia:Rapier")***

A rapier (/ˈreɪpiər/) is a type of sword with a slender and sharply-pointed double-edged blade; some historical rapier samples feature a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword")-like blade mounted on a typical rapier hilt. The term dates back to the mid-16th century, and the sword was popular throughout 16th-and-17th century Western Europe, both for civilian use and as a military side arm. Rapiers are also popularly known as dueling weapons.

## Reference

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [objects.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 196](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/objects.c#line196 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/objects.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [artifact.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1244](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/artifact.c#line1244 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/artifact.c")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")
html:
Rapier

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

A rapier is a type of sword that appears in SLASH'EM and dNethack. It is made of metal and uses the saber skill.

Contents

  • 1 SLASH'EM
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 dNethack
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Reference

SLASH'EM

)
Name rapier
Appearance rapier
Damage vs. small 1d6
Damage vs. large 1d8
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill saber
Size one-handed
Base price 40 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 30
Material metal

Rapiers are comparable in damage to sabers while being somewhat lighter.

Generation

Rapiers are not randomly generated in SLASH'EM. A player monster rogue in the halls of Grund's Stronghold will always generate with a +1 rapier.

Comments in the source code indicate that a rapier was intended to be the base item for an artifact weapon named Scalpel, which was carried over from SLASH 6.[1][2]

dNethack

)
Name rapier
Appearance rapier
Damage vs. small 1d6
Damage vs. large 1d4
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill saber
Size one-handed
Base price 20 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 28
Material metal

In dNetHack, rapiers are medium-sized, one-handed piercing weapons. They receive only half the normal strength bonus to damage, but also gain a (DEX - 11)⁄2 bonus.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Rapier

A rapier (/ˈreɪpiər/) is a type of sword with a slender and sharply-pointed double-edged blade; some historical rapier samples feature a broadsword-like blade mounted on a typical rapier hilt. The term dates back to the mid-16th century, and the sword was popular throughout 16th-and-17th century Western Europe, both for civilian use and as a military side arm. Rapiers are also popularly known as dueling weapons.

Reference

  1. ↑ objects.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 196
  2. ↑ artifact.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1244

A '''rapier''' is a type of sword that appears in [[SLASH'EM]] and [[dNethack]]. It is made of [[metal]] and uses the [[saber]] skill.

==SLASH'EM==
{{weapon
 |tile=[[image:rapier.png]]
 |name=rapier
 |smalldmg=1d6
 |largedmg=1d8

 |cost=40
 |weight=30
 |material=metal
}}
Rapiers are comparable in damage to sabers while being somewhat lighter.

===Generation===
Rapiers are not randomly generated in SLASH'EM. A [[player monster]] [[rogue (player monster)|rogue]] in the halls of [[Grund's Stronghold]] will [[Monster starting inventory|always generate with]] a [[enchantment|+1]] rapier.

Comments in the source code indicate that a rapier was intended to be the [[base item]] for an [[artifact weapon]] named [[Scalpel (artifact)|Scalpel]], which was carried over from [[SLASH 6]].{{refsrc|objects.c|196|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|artifact.c|1244|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

{{clear}}

}}
In dNetHack, rapiers are medium-sized, one-handed piercing weapons. They receive only half the normal strength bonus to damage, but also gain a {{frac|(DEX - 11)|2}} bonus.

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Rapier}}
A rapier (/ˈreɪpiər/) is a type of sword with a slender and sharply-pointed double-edged blade; some historical rapier samples feature a [[broadsword]]-like blade mounted on a typical rapier hilt. The term dates back to the mid-16th century, and the sword was popular throughout 16th-and-17th century Western Europe, both for civilian use and as a military side arm. Rapiers are also popularly known as dueling weapons.
